caption: The once-bustling bridge, adorned with numerous locks left by visitors, now stands with a single spot adorned with a few locks.
This very narrow stone bridge spans the seine into Ile de cite,
Unfortunately you can't hang locks there, but there is a fence where people are placing their locks now. It's a pretty bridge, with a good view. A shame the Notre Dame is still closed off.

One of the gorgeous bridges spanning across the Seine. This one though is more special as it provides a panoramic view of the Notre Dame as it framed by the river and beautiful gardens. As you know, the church was recently damaged by a fire and is now undergoing restoration/repair as evidenced by the scaffolding around it. This does not detract from the aura of "historical greatness " surrounding the cathedral. Go visit, say a prayer for our world. Please.
Last locks available on the bridge. Everything else has plastic on the bridge
My heart goes to the people of France, visited Notre Dame a day after the great fire that devastated this iconic structure.
A bridge to see what is left of Notre Dame, currently on of the side streets of the church is closed so you have to cros the bride to see the left side.
A place full of history! Extremely frequented by tourists. In the vicinity there are many restaurants and cafes for any type of preference.
A place worth spending some quality time !!
Wanted to see the Love Locked Bridge but, the Bridge does not exist anymore.
Lovely coffee shop facing Notre Dame
I left a lock here with my wife 20 years ago. After 55 years of marriage she decided to leave me for my mate Barry. I miss you Jill, please come home. It's a nice bridge I guess.
Great spot to take pics of the cathedral.
Normally a great place for Notre Dame pictures, but since the fire the pictures are sad.
A bridge on the back end of the Notre Dame Cathedral. I walked by here while walking around the remains of the cathedral.

So beautiful! Love La Seine and all the ponts from which to see it. High tide, stairs to nowhere! Great view of the back and side of Notre Dame! My favorite views. Still so sad seeing the damage from the fire. None the less majestic!
Amazing view of Notre Dame Cathedral.
Good view of Notre Dame during reconstruction.
Very nice venue around this bridge.
Beautiful bridge on Sienne river
Loving this place.  View is amazing.

Just happened to be walking along the Seine and came upon this bridge. At street level it's closed off since it ends at the burned Notre Dame. Kind of neat looking from beneath. Have to hand it to the craftsmen for that era with their steel work.

Nothing really nice to see especially since the French government decided to make illegal the only thing making the bridge worthy to be visited. Not aloud to put any locks on it and there is really nothing to be seen except from half burnt Cathedral Notre Dame de Paris.
All locks have been removed ðŸ˜ž â€¦
Our padlock from 10 years ago is unfortunately gone. Looks extremely ugly with the plexiglass
Nice view of Notre Dame
I have many good memory from this bridge. I even left a lock there once. I love the view. Itâ€™s a nice play to take pictures.
Vantage point for Notre-Dame albeit the missing spires.
If you want to see Notre dame cathedral from the side, you have to go to this bridge. The view is ok but it's not an iconic one
It was ok but no longer the locks look ugly
Sad to see it this way. Took the kids to France and really wanted them to witness it, especially from an architectural perspective. Alot does still remain an still looks amazing.
Lovely senic views. The work seems to be coming along nicely
It's an experience. Usually a busker with great music, Notre Dame, the Seine.... Many people just stopping for a moment to just be. Tourists and locals.
We stopped in for a quick appetizer. The food and the service were good.
The Bridge of the Bishopric provides an excellent view of the rear exterior of the Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris.
One of the many bridges that crosses the Seine river and joins the mainland to the island where the Notre Dame is located.
So beautiful
Another  of my favourite spots.
